TopicTitle: [1.12] HyperEdit [v1.5.8, July 10, 2018] - Cheat, Teleporter, Orbit/Planet Editor, & More

Articles.Content:
When using HyperEdit for landing coordinates, input North & East coordinates as POSITIVE numbers and South & West coordinates as NEGATIVE numbers.

For example, if you want to land on the Mun & the KSP coordinates are:

10 52 42 N

52 21 31 W

The landing coordinates for HyperEdit will be:

10.878333

-52.358611

To help convert the KSP/MechJeb coordinates to HyperEdit coordinates, I use this website: https://www.fcc.gov/encyclopedia/degrees-minutes-seconds-tofrom-decimal-degrees

I hope this helps.

That sounds right to me. Thanks for helping out, rochieren!
No worries. Just trying to keep the frustration level low for my fellow KSP players.

I'm proud to announce that Kerbaltek now has more than 500 registered members.

266 of us have created Ribbon sets, and those images have been viewed more than 1.3 million times, mostly from this forum.

HyperEdit has been downloaded nearly 210 thousand times, and our latest addition, Graphotron has been downloaded over 1000 times. HyperEdit was the reason I created Kerbaltek, and so I post this here.

I feel very lucky to be involved with such a great community , and I look forward to more fun in the future. Thanks, everyone!

Gratz on the stats.

I guess this is kind of a 'feature request'. Hyper edit is invaluable for testing landers, it would be great if it could also be useful for testing aerocapture designs. Maybe I just don't know how to drive the orbit editor. If you could set up a hyperbolic orbit that would be great; (radius, pe, prograde velocity). Maybe the hyperbolic is complex (find the direction vector to make it work etc) but a (radius, velocity) and pointing straight at the planet would let one easily put a ship near SOI and tweak the pe by hand.

What do you think?

Maybe I just don't know how to drive the orbit editor. If you could set up a hyperbolic orbit that would be great;

Hyperbolic orbits are in Hyperedit already. Click Orbit, then click "graphical." Go into map mode and play with the sliders to see what they do.

ping kerbaltek.com

It should look like:

Hello, I was wondering how you change the SOI on a planet. for example I relocated gilly into a 1 000 000m orbit around kerbin, but whenever I try to intersect it "interfears" within 1m?!?!

Hello, I was wondering how you change the SOI on a planet. for example I relocated gilly into a 1 000 000m orbit around kerbin, but whenever I try to intersect it "interfears" within 1m?!?!

Using Orbit Editor, choose the planet with Currently editing, then select the SOI with Reference body.

As for the issue of "intersect" and "interfears", I'd need more details to know what you mean.

I hope this helps.

Please give more details about your attempts to land. Describe each step you're doing, and where the problem starts.

As mentioned, the problem you describe with the site must be something on your own PC, your local network, or with your Internet Service Provider (ISP).

EDIT: Sorry, I misunderstood. "Land Here" does just that - it lands your ship at its current location.

To land at the coords you chose, click the "Landing" radio button. This is an issue that we intend to change - to make the lander buttons more intuitive.

Edited July 10, 2015 by Ezriilc
Works fine now thanks !!!!!

Works fine now thanks !!!!!

Oh good! I'm glad. You're most welcome of course, and welcome to the forums!

I just want to praise HyperEdit a bit.

I had a NaN bugged out space station (that would crash the game if I jumped to it). It was not super complex but deleting it and putting it back would have been a bit of a chore.

Based on looking at the vessel in map mode, the problem appeared to be that its orbit was... nonexistent. It was just a point in space with no orbit drawn. So, I loaded up HyperEdit and gave it an orbit. And what do you know, it's back to fully working and accessible in all ways.

Is your rocketship out of fuel and on a collision course with an asteroid?

Has your space station lost its orbit?

Do you need to test a lander for Eve without all the tediousness of actually launching and traveling there?

Then you need... HYPER EDIT!
Hyper edit is the best if your testing landers and re-entry makes life very easy
